verses.verse: The wild beasts of the desert shall also meet with the jackals, And the wild goat shall bleat to its companion; Also the night creature shall rest there, And find for herself a place of rest.
There the arrow snake shall make her nest and lay eggs And hatch, and gather them under her shadow; There also shall the hawks be gathered, Every one with her mate.
“Search from ((Mal. 3:16)) the book of the LORD, and read: Not one of these shall fail; Not one shall lack her mate. For My mouth has commanded it, and His Spirit has gathered them.
He has cast the lot for them, And His hand has divided it among them with a measuring line. They shall possess it forever; From generation to generation they shall dwell in it.”
(The Future Glory of Zion) The (Is. 32:15; 55:12) wilderness and the wasteland shall be glad for them, And the (Is. 41:19; 51:3) desert shall rejoice and blossom as the rose;

(Is. 32:15) It shall blossom abundantly and rejoice, Even with joy and singing. The glory of Lebanon shall be given to it, The excellence of Carmel and Sharon. They shall see the (Is. 40:5) glory of the LORD, The excellency of our God.
(Job 4:3, 4; Heb. 12:12) Strengthen the weak hands, And make firm the feeble knees.
Say to those who are fearful-hearted, “Be strong, do not fear! Behold, your God will come with (Is. 34:8) vengeance, With the recompense of God; He will come and (Ps. 145:19; Is. 33:22) save you.”
Then the (Is. 29:18; Matt. 9:27; John 9:6, 7) eyes of the blind shall be opened, And ((Matt. 11:5)) the ears of the deaf shall be unstopped.

Then the (Matt. 11:5; 15:30; John 5:8, 9; Acts 8:7) lame shall leap like a deer, And the (Is. 32:4; Matt. 9:32; 12:22) tongue of the dumb sing. For (Is. 41:18; (John 7:38)) waters shall burst forth in the wilderness, And streams in the desert.
The parched ground shall become a pool, And the thirsty land springs of water; In (Is. 34:13) the habitation of jackals, where each lay, There shall be grass with reeds and rushes.

A (Is. 19:23) highway shall be there, and a road, And it shall be called the Highway of Holiness. (Is. 52:1; Joel 3:17; (Matt. 7:13, 14); 1 Pet. 1:15, 16; Rev. 21:27) The unclean shall not pass over it, But it shall be for others. Whoever walks the road, although a fool, Shall not go astray.
(Lev. 26:6; (Is. 11:7, 9); Ezek. 34:25) No lion shall be there, Nor shall any ravenous beast go up on it; It shall not be found there. But the redeemed shall walk there,

And the (Is. 51:11) ransomed of the LORD shall return, And come to Zion with singing, With everlasting joy on their heads. They shall obtain joy and gladness, And (Is. 25:8; 30:19; 65:19; (Rev. 7:17; 21:4)) sorrow and sighing shall flee away.

(Sennacherib Boasts Against the LORD) Now (2 Kin. 18:13, 17; 2 Chr. 32:1) it came to pass in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah that Sennacherib king of Assyria came up against all the fortified cities of Judah and took them.
Then the king of Assyria sent the Rabshakeh with a great army from Lachish to King Hezekiah at Jerusalem. And he stood by the aqueduct from the upper pool, on the highway to the Fuller’s Field.
And (Is. 22:20) Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, (Is. 22:15) Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the recorder, came out to him.
(2 Kin. 18:19) Then the Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: “What confidence is this in which you trust?
I say you speak of having plans and power for war; but they are mere words. Now in whom do you trust, that you rebel against me?

Look! You are trusting in the (Ezek. 29:6) staff of this broken reed, Egypt, on which if a man leans, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who (Ps. 146:3; Is. 30:3, 5, 7) trust in him.

“But if you say to me, ‘We trust in the LORD our God,’ is it not He whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away, and said to Judah and Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar’?” ’
Now therefore, I urge you, give a pledge to my master the king of Assyria, and I will give you two thousand horses—if you are able on your part to put riders on them!
